channel.title: Birth Tissue Recovery
channel.description: Birth tissue and placenta donation program.

item.title: STUDY: Zika Virus Persists in Testes, Damages Tissue in Mice
item.dc:creator: btr-content
item.description:
“Zika virus remained in mouse testes after the infection had cleared from the blood, causing testicular tissue to atrophy and potentially affecting fertility, according to a study in mice published in Science Advances. The finding may explain why Zika virus appears to be sexually transmissible. Although the findings have yet to be replicated in humans, […]

The post STUDY: Zika Virus Persists in Testes, Damages Tissue in Mice appeared first on Birth Tissue Recovery.

item.title: CDC Zika Testing Tool
item.dc:creator: btr-content
item.description:
Recently, CDC updated its interim guidance for providers caring for pregnant women with possible Zika virus exposure. This tool is intended for healthcare providers and public health officials in the United States.  It is part of the public health response to protect pregnant women because of the risks associated with Zika virus infection during pregnancy. […]

The post CDC Zika Testing Tool appeared first on Birth Tissue Recovery.

item.title: Anna Greene McDonald, MD Appointed as Medical Director
item.dc:creator: btr-content
item.description:
Birth Tissue Recovery announces the appointment of Anna Greene McDonald, MD as the company’s medical director, effective July 1, 2016.  Dr. McDonald is board certified in anatomic and clinical pathology and pediatric pathology, both by the  American Board of Pathology.  She has particular interest is perinatal and placental pathology.

The post Anna Greene McDonald, MD Appointed as Medical Director appeared first on Birth Tissue Recovery.

item.title: BTR Enhances Donor Screening Criteria for Zika Virus
item.dc:creator: btr-content
item.description:
Because Zika virus (ZIKV) has been identified by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration as a relevant communicable disease agent or disease, with potential for transmission by human tissue intended for transplantation, BTR is implementing appropriate donor screening measures. Currently, there is no donor antibody screening test for ZIKV. Therefore, BTR’s donor screening procedures have […]

The post BTR Enhances Donor Screening Criteria for Zika Virus appeared first on Birth Tissue Recovery.
